question.title: Convert min heap to max heap
question.content:
You are given an array/list (arr) representing a min-heap. Your task is to write a function that converts the min-heap to a max-heap.

 Note :
Change in the input array/list itself. You don't need to return or print the elements.
Input format :
The first line contains an integer 't' which denotes the number of test cases or queries to be run. Then the test cases follow.

The first line of each test case or query contains an integer 'N' representing the size of the array/list.

The second line contains 'N' single space separated integers representing the elements in the array/list which are in the form of a min-heap.
Output Format :
For each test case or query, If the built max-heap satisfies the max-heap condition, print 'true'. Otherwise, print 'false'(without quotes).

Output for every test case will be printed in a separate line.
 Note :
You don't have to print anything, it has already been taken care. Build the max-heap in the given array/list itself or in-place
Constraints :
1 <= t <= 100
0 <= N <= 10^5

Time Limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1 :
1
7
1 2 3 4 5 6 7
Sample Output 1 :
true

Since it is possible to create a max heap so answer should be true.

Sample Input 2 :
1
2
1 2
Sample Output 2 :
true
Explanation for Input 2 :
In this case, there is only one max heap possible.

rephrased.body: Given an array `arr` of length `n` representing a min-heap, rearrange the elements in-place to convert it into a max-heap. You are provided with the array and its size.  You do not need to return anything; modify the input array directly.

testcases.explanation:
For a min-heap, there can be multiple max heaps possible. For example:

Since it is possible to create a max heap so answer should be true. Any valid max-heap arrangement of [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] will result in a 'true' output.
In this case, there is only one max heap possible, [2, 1].
The min-heap [1, 3, 5, 7, 9] can be transformed into a max-heap. For example [9, 7, 5, 3, 1] is one such possible arrangement.

The min-heap [2, 10, 20, 12, 15, 18] can be transformed to a max-heap.  A valid max-heap is possible from the given input. One such arrangement could be [20, 15, 18, 2, 10, 12] or [20, 15, 18, 12, 10, 2].
An empty array is already a valid max heap (trivially).

hints: Don't try to convert a min heap to max heap. Just collect all numbers from the min heap and construct a max heap like you would normally do
Start from the rightmost element in the bottom-most layer of the heap. Can you think of a way to transfer that element to the position it would occupy in the max heap?
